T26.G8.01.title: Design end-to-end telemetry pipelines
T26.G8.01.description: Students draw a pipeline for a multi-level game (client logs → cleaning script → storage table → CSV export), emphasizing interfaces between steps.

T26.G8.02.title: Implement scheduled data exports and resets
T26.G8.02.description: Learners script timed routines that export a table to file (or display) and then clear/reset logs, mirroring production data rotation.

T26.G8.03.title: Integrate XO guidance into data scripts
T26.G8.03.description: Students send their collection protocol to XO (T24) for review, then document accepted and rejected suggestions, showing human oversight of AI advice.

T26.G8.04.title: Publish data privacy agreements for peers
T26.G8.04.description: Learners author a short agreement describing what data will be collected, how it’s stored, who can access it, and deletion timelines, tying back to AI4K12’s societal-impact focus.

T27.G8.01.title: Run hypothesis tests or statistical significance checks
T27.G8.01.description: Students use simple statistical reasoning (e.g., simulate or compute standard error) to judge whether observed differences are likely due to chance, documenting assumptions.

T27.G8.02.title: Automate report generation
T27.G8.02.description: Learners build scripts that assemble updated charts and textual findings (using variables) at the press of a button, supporting repeatable reporting.

T27.G8.03.title: Integrate analysis into AI prompt engineering
T27.G8.03.description: Students summarize key stats and pass them to XO (“Given these metrics, suggest improvements”), then vet the AI’s recommendations against the actual data.

T27.G8.04.title: Publish public-facing data stories
T27.G8.04.description: Learners create polished stories (web page, slideshow) that include charts, context, ethical considerations, and calls to action, mirroring civic data journalism.

T28.G8.01.title: Chain simulation → analysis → dashboard
T28.G8.01.description: Students automate simulations, store results, and auto-refresh charts/HUD elements so stakeholders can explore scenarios live.

T28.G8.02.title: Estimate uncertainty via bootstrap/resampling
T28.G8.02.description: Learners repeatedly resample collected data (with replacement) to produce distributions of a statistic and report percentile-based intervals.

T28.G8.03.title: Integrate simulations into XO/AI workflows
T28.G8.03.description: Students summarize simulation outcomes, pass them to XO, and evaluate whether AI recommendations align with the data.

T28.G8.04.title: Publish simulation-backed policy briefs
T28.G8.04.description: Learners write briefs outlining scenario, simulation method, findings, and ethical impacts (winners/losers), mirroring civic data journalism.

T28.G8.05.title: Analyze how environment design can bias agent behavior
T28.G8.05.description: Students compare two simulations where the same agent 'learns' in different environments (e.g., one with many obstacles near the reward, one with none). They write a short analysis on how the environm...

T29.G8.01.title: Build end-to-end text-processing pipelines
T29.G8.01.description: Students design scripts that ingest raw text, normalize it, extract features, run analysis (sentiment or retrieval), and save results for future prompts.

T29.G8.02.title: Compute evaluation metrics (precision/recall/F1)
T29.G8.02.description: Learners compare predicted vs actual labels and compute precision, recall, and F1, interpreting tradeoffs.

T29.G8.03.title: Integrate analytics into AI prompting
T29.G8.03.description: Students embed text analytics (top keywords, sentiment) into XO prompt templates and evaluate whether responses improve.

T29.G8.04.title: Publish datasheets for text datasets
T29.G8.04.description: Learners author “datasheet” reports covering dataset source, collection process, limitations, and maintenance plans, aligning with AI transparency best practices.

T30.G8.01.title: Architect edge vs cloud processing for AI pipelines
T30.G8.01.description: Students design diagrams showing which AI computations happen on-device (T23 camera feed processing for low latency, privacy-sensitive voice recognition) and which go to the cloud (T21 DALL-E generati...

T30.G8.02.title: Evaluate sustainability & lifecycle impacts
T30.G8.02.description: Learners research energy use, e-waste, and sourcing for devices used in class projects and recommend sustainable practices.

T30.G8.03.title: Plan hardware integration tests
T30.G8.03.description: Students create test plans covering multiple device types, OS versions, and peripherals to ensure their software behaves consistently.

T30.G8.04.title: Publish hardware requirement/playbooks for teams
T30.G8.04.description: Learners write “hardware playbooks” describing required devices, setup steps, troubleshooting, and accessibility considerations so others can replicate builds.

T31.G8.01.title: Architect edge vs cloud processing pipelines for AI
T31.G8.01.description: Students design diagrams showing which AI computations happen on-device (T23 camera preprocessing for privacy, real-time gesture recognition) and which require cloud resources (T21 DALL-E generation, ...

T31.G8.02.title: Understand AI service network requirements
T31.G8.02.description: Students analyze bandwidth, latency, and reliability requirements for T21-T24 AI features (real-time voice for T22, image upload for T21, continuous sensor data for T23) and design network architectur...

T31.G8.03.title: Design secure AI-powered cloud systems
T31.G8.03.description: Students outline authentication, encryption, and server-side validation for AI-powered apps using T21-T24 features. They address prompt injection attacks on T22 chatbots, unauthorized access to T21 im...

T31.G8.04.title: Implement privacy protection for AI data
T31.G8.04.description: Students implement privacy measures for AI data: hashing T24 XO prompt logs, encrypting T23 sensor data before cloud storage, and anonymizing T22 chatbot conversations. They use simple encryption tech...

T31.G8.05.title: Evaluate AI service resilience and fallbacks
T31.G8.05.description: Students analyze failure scenarios for T21-T24 AI dependencies (OpenAI API downtime, speech recognition failures) and design graceful degradation strategies (cached responses, offline modes, manual fa...

T31.G8.06.title: Build AI service monitoring and ethics dashboards
T31.G8.06.description: Students create monitoring dashboards that track T21-T24 AI service usage (API call counts, response times, error rates) and ethical metrics (content moderation flags, bias detection alerts, user cons...

T32.G8.01.title: Conduct mini penetration tests (with permission)
T32.G8.01.description: Students follow teacher-approved checklists (input fuzzing, bad passwords) to probe their games/apps, documenting findings.

T32.G8.02.title: Implement role-based access controls
T32.G8.02.description: Learners design a simple role system (admin vs player) inside a CreatiCode project and enforce permissions.

T32.G8.03.title: Conduct comprehensive AI security and ethics audits
T32.G8.03.description: Students conduct detailed audits of AI projects covering T21 image generation (bias in outputs, content moderation), T22 chatbots (prompt injection, inappropriate responses), T23 perception (consent, ...

T32.G8.04.title: Publish incident response plans
T32.G8.04.description: Learners draft plans covering detection, containment, communication, and recovery for classroom systems (shared devices, club servers).

T33.G8.01.title: Analyze legal and ethical obligations when integrating services
T33.G8.01.description: Students read summarized terms for services (OpenAI, speech APIs) and document obligations (attribution, safety filters, prohibited content). They tie requirements to their project design.

T33.G8.02.title: Simulate service outages and design fallbacks
T33.G8.02.description: Learners create an outage simulator (forcing error responses) and design fallback experiences (offline mode, manual input). They document recovery procedures.

T33.G8.03.title: Integrate third-party tool output into moderation workflows
T33.G8.03.description: Students create comprehensive moderation workflows for T21-T24 AI outputs: content safety filters for T21 images and T22 text, bias detection for all AI responses, consent verification for T23 sensor ...

T33.G8.04.title: Document build-vs-buy decisions for new features
T33.G8.04.description: Learners evaluate criteria (time, accuracy, privacy, cost) and write recommendations on whether to rely on existing CreatiCode blocks or implement a custom algorithm for a feature.

T34.G8.01.title: Synthesize trends into future forecasts
T34.G8.01.description: Students analyze historical data (processor speeds, adoption curves) and write evidence-based forecasts for future tech (AI tutors, AR classrooms).

T34.G8.02.title: Analyze cross-cultural innovation ecosystems
T34.G8.02.description: Learners investigate policies, education, and industry in two regions (e.g., Kenya’s mobile hubs vs Estonia’s e-government) and link findings to historical roots.

T34.G8.03.title: Produce primary-source inspired research projects
T34.G8.03.description: Students gather primary sources (oral histories, historical photos) and create a multimedia presentation connecting past lessons to their own projects (AI, games, data).

T35.G8.01.title: Analyze AI chatbots' impact on information literacy (Pairing with T22)
T35.G8.01.description: Following T22 chatbot projects, students analyze how AI-generated answers affect research habits, critical thinking, misinformation spread, and educational equity. They examine differential impacts on...

T35.G8.02.title: Draft equity-focused policy briefs for AI in education
T35.G8.02.description: Learners synthesize evidence and stakeholder input into policy briefs that center equity in AI use for schools. They address differential access to T21-T24 tools, bias in AI outputs, privacy protectio...

T35.G8.03.title: Design impact assessments for CreatiCode projects
T35.G8.03.description: Students create rubrics assessing accessibility, privacy, wellbeing, and cultural sensitivity before publishing games/apps.

T35.G8.04.title: Lead peer workshops on responsible tech use
T35.G8.04.description: Learners develop workshops/demos for younger grades on topics like screen balance, online kindness, or AI use.

T36.G8.01.title: Build multi-year career roadmaps
T36.G8.01.description: Students choose a target role (AI researcher, UX engineer, civic technologist) and outline high school coursework, extracurriculars, and portfolio goals.

T36.G8.02.title: Prepare resumes/portfolios and practice interviews
T36.G8.02.description: Learners assemble mini portfolios of CreatiCode projects, write short resumes, and conduct mock interviews with peers/mentors.

T36.G8.03.title: Analyze AI's differential impact on future work and equity (Pairing with T24)
T36.G8.03.description: Following T24 XO and AI practices work, students research how AI coding assistants and automation affect different communities unequally. They analyze which jobs face displacement vs augmentation, how...

T36.G8.04.title: Facilitate capstone retrospectives with stakeholders
T36.G8.04.description:
Learners run retrospectives for their final projects, gather peer/teacher feedback, and publish action items for future teams.
